messages.message: There's also a flag called is_guest, and if you're a guest it makes it so that you can do a lot of the things that can_read, can_write, and can_delete would make you think you could do

What powers does the guest flag give you? So i think there’s a bool field you get back when you get filesystem permission from the backend called “is_acl_enabled”. Basically if that’s false, the backend doesn’t provide any ACL guidelines. Maybe you should respect the _guest flag in that case?
